p: The presence of AM fungi increased total shoot biomass in both growing periods (first growing period; F (1, 40) = 49.94, p < .001 and second growing period; F (1, 37) = 20.55, p < .001; Figure 2a,b). AM fungi also had a significant effect on plant species composition and abundance of the three functional groups, i.e., forbs (Hieracium, Plantago, Senecio), legumes (Lotus), and grasses (Festuca, Poa and Holcus) (Table S3). Shoot biomass of forbs and legumes increased in microcosms with AM fungi, whereas grasses dominated microcosms without AM fungi (Figure 2a,b). Root biomass was influenced by rainfall regime, with higher biomass under moderate‐intensity rain than under high‐intensity rain (moderate; 5.25 g ± 0.44, high; 3.94 g ± 0.27; F (1,37) = 9.14, p < .01; Fig. S4). The presence of AM fungi did not significantly influence root biomass (Fig. S4).
